title: Wales 20 France 19 Rugby World Cup 2019 player ratings: Who fired in the heat of battle, and who disappointed?
text:
Ross Moriarty scored the winning try as Wales defeated 14-man France 20-19 in an incredible comeback victory that secures their semi-final spot.

French lock Sebastien Vahaamahina had been shown a red card in the 49th minute for foul play with his team leading.

But Moriarty crossed the line with six minutes left on the clock to set up a semi-final against hosts Japan or South Africa, who play shortly.

Which players rose to the occasion and who wilted? Alex Bywater dishes out the marks from Oita.

Wales

15. Liam Williams

Reliable as ever and always looking to attack. He is a world class operator and remained calm amid the chaos of a thrilling finale. 7

14. George North

Zero ball to attack with...
description: Ross Moriarty scored the winning try as Wales defeated 14-man France 20-19 in an incredible comeback victory that secures their semi-final spot.
